data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
data.description: Control should prevent adversaries who may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.

tests.title: Storage Accounts HTTPS
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS-only traffic is allowed to storage account endpoints
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts can contain sensitive information and should only be accessed over HTTPS. Enabling the HTTPS-only flag ensures that Azure does not allow HTTP traffic to Storage Accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the HTTPS-only option for all Storage Accounts.
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the storage account

tests.title: HTTPS Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS Only is enabled for App Services, redirecting all HTTP traffic to HTTPS
tests.more_info: Enabling HTTPS Only traffic will redirect all non-secure HTTP requests to HTTPS. HTTPS uses the SSL/TLS protocol to provide a secure connection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS Only support SSL settings for all App Services
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Detect Insecure Custom Origin
tests.description: Ensures that HTTPS is enabled for CDN endpoints with a custom origin
tests.more_info: All Azure CDN endpoints should enable HTTPS to secure traffic to the backend custom origin.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS and disable HTTP for each custom origin endpoint for each CDN profile.

tests.title: Monitor VM Vulnerability
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor Vulnerability Assessment is enabled in Security Center.
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor virtual machines for detected vulnerabilities.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure VM Vulnerability monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

tests.title: LB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures load balancers are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports
tests.more_info: For maximum security, load balancers can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections will be blocked. This should only be done if the client application is configured to query HTTPS directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each load balancer only accepts connections on port 443.

data.name: Trusted Relationships
data.description: Monitor activity conducted by second and third party providers and other trusted entities that may be leveraged as a means to gain access to the network.

tests.title: Storage Accounts HTTPS
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS-only traffic is allowed to storage account endpoints
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts can contain sensitive information and should only be accessed over HTTPS. Enabling the HTTPS-only flag ensures that Azure does not allow HTTP traffic to Storage Accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the HTTPS-only option for all Storage Accounts.
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the storage account

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

tests.title: Storage Accounts AAD Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure Files
tests.more_info: Enabling identity-based Authentication ensures that only the authorized Active Directory members can access or connect to the file shares, enforcing granular access control.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure File Shares.

data.name: Valid accounts
data.description: Valid accounts should be protected to prevent invalid access

tests.title: Password Requires Lowercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require lowercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Numbers
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require numbers
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require symbol characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Uppercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require uppercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require a minimum length
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including the minimum password length, defaulted to 8 characters.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

data.name: Account Manipulation
data.description: Measures should be put in place to prevent the manipulation of accounts giving access to systems.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.

data.name: Implant Container Image
data.description: Controls should be in place to prevent attackers from implanting container images with malicious code.

tests.title: Blob Container Private Access
tests.description: Ensures that all blob containers do not have anonymous public access set
tests.more_info: Blob containers set with public access enables anonymous users to read blobs within a publicly accessible container without authentication. All blob containers should have private access configured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each blob container is configured to restrict anonymous access
tests.remediation_description: Access level for affected blob containers will be set to private

tests.title: Log Container Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that the Activity Log Container does not have public read access
tests.more_info: The container used to store Activity Log data should not be exposed publicly to avoid data exposure of sensitive activity logs.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the access level for the storage account containing Activity Log data is set to private.

tests.title: ACR Admin User
tests.description: Ensures that the admin user is not enabled on container registries
tests.more_info: Azure Container Registries have an admin user that is designed for testing. This should be disabled by default to avoid sharing confidential admin credentials.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the admin user is disabled for each container registry.

data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
data.description: Privilege escalation on valid accounts should be curbed.

tests.title: VM Auto Update Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that VM Auto Update is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Enabling Auto Update on Azure virtual machines reduces the security risk of missing security patches.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM auto update on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor System Updates
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor System Updates is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will audit virtual machines for pending OS or system updates.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure System Update monitoring is configured for virtual machines from the Azure Security Center.

data.name: Impair Defences
data.description: Necessary permissions should be in place to prevent defence mechanisms modification in a bid to impair defence mechanisms in place.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Endpoint Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that endpoint requests are being logged for CDN endpoints
tests.more_info: Endpoint Logging ensures that all requests to a CDN endpoint are logged.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that diagnostic logging is enabled for each CDN endpoint for each CDN profile

tests.title: Security Solution Logging
tests.description: Ensures Activity Log Alerts for the create or update and delete Security Solution events are enabled
tests.more_info: Monitoring for create or update and delete Security Solution events gives insight into event changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Add a new log alert to the Alerts service that monitors for Security Solution create or update and delete events.

data.name: Modify Cloud Compute Infrastructure
data.description: Modification of Cloud compute infrastructure should be detected and prevented.

tests.title: File Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures file shares do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: File shares can be configured to allow to read, write, or delete permissions from a share. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all file shares and ensure the share ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Table Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures tables do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Table Service tables can be configured to allow to read, write or delete on objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, and delete policies on all tables and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Queue Service All Access ACL
tests.description: Ensures queues do not allow full write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: Queues can be configured to allow object read, write or delete. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global read, write, delete policies on all queues and ensure the ACL is configured with least privileges.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Auditing
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Auditing is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor SQL databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL auditing monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Resource Location Matches Resource Group
tests.description: Ensures a policy is configured to audit that deployed resource locations match their resource group locations
tests.more_info: Using Azure Policy to monitor resource location compliance helps ensure that new resources are not launched into locations that do not match their resource group.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the built-in Azure Policy definition: Audit resource location matches resource group location

tests.title: Database Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database Auditing is enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Database Auditing ensures that all database activities are being logged properly, including potential malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.

tests.title: Audit Retention Policy
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing retention policy is set to greater than 90 days
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity. Having a long retention policy ensures that all logs are kept for auditing and legal purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the storage account retention policy for each SQL server is set to greater than 90 days.

tests.title: Audit Action Groups Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is configured properly
tests.more_info: SQL Server Audit Action and Groups should be configured to at least include SUCCESSFUL_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP, FAILED_DATABASE_AUTHENTICATION_GROUP and BATCH_COMPLETED_GROUP.
tests.recommended_action: If SQL Server Audit Action and Groups is not configured properly when enabling Auditing, these settings must be configured in Powershell.

tests.title: Server Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Server Auditing is enabled for SQL servers
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Server Auditing ensures that all activities are being logged properly, including potentially-malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL server.

data.name: Unused/Unsupported Cloud Regions
data.description: Cloud access from unsupported regions should be detected and prevented.

tests.title: Log Profile Archive Data
tests.description: Ensures the Log Profile is configured to export all activities from the control and management planes in all active locations
tests.more_info: Exporting log activity for control plane activity allows for audited access to the Azure account with event data in the case of a security incident.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all activity is logged to the Event Hub or storage account for archiving.

tests.title: Resources Allowed Locations
tests.description: Ensures deployed resources and resource groups belong to the list set in the allowed locations for resource groups policy
tests.more_info: Setting allowed locations for a service helps ensure the service can only be deployed in expected locations.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all services contain policy definitions that defined allowed locations.

tests.title: Resource Location Matches Resource Group
tests.description: Ensures a policy is configured to audit that deployed resource locations match their resource group locations
tests.more_info: Using Azure Policy to monitor resource location compliance helps ensure that new resources are not launched into locations that do not match their resource group.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the built-in Azure Policy definition: Audit resource location matches resource group location

tests.title: Network Watcher Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Network Watcher is enabled in all locations
tests.more_info: Network Watcher helps locate, diagnose, and gain insights into Azure networks. Enabling Network Watcher in all locations ensures that no resources are being used in locations that are not authorized.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the Network Watcher service in all locations.

data.name: Brute Force
data.description: Additional password controls are needed to ensure password security is not bypassed.

tests.title: Password Requires Lowercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require lowercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Numbers
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require numbers
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require symbol characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Password Requires Uppercase
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require uppercase characters
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including which character types are required. Azure requires 3 out of 4 of the following character types: lowercase, uppercase, special characters, and numbers.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures that all Azure passwords require a minimum length
tests.more_info: Azure handles most password policy settings, including the minimum password length, defaulted to 8 characters.
tests.recommended_action: No action necessary. Azure handles password requirement settings.

data.name: Unsecured Credentials
data.description: Misplaced or unsecurely stored credentials could result to breaches if attackers comes in contact and thus should be well secured.

tests.title: Storage Accounts HTTPS
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS-only traffic is allowed to storage account endpoints
tests.more_info: Storage Accounts can contain sensitive information and should only be accessed over HTTPS. Enabling the HTTPS-only flag ensures that Azure does not allow HTTP traffic to Storage Accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the HTTPS-only option for all Storage Accounts.
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the storage account

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Data Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Data Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM Data Disks (non-boot volume) ensures that its entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM Data Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: HTTPS Only Enabled
tests.description: Ensures HTTPS Only is enabled for App Services, redirecting all HTTP traffic to HTTPS
tests.more_info: Enabling HTTPS Only traffic will redirect all non-secure HTTP requests to HTTPS. HTTPS uses the SSL/TLS protocol to provide a secure connection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS Only support SSL settings for all App Services
tests.remediation_description: The HTTPS-only option will be enabled for the web app

tests.title: Detect Insecure Custom Origin
tests.description: Ensures that HTTPS is enabled for CDN endpoints with a custom origin
tests.more_info: All Azure CDN endpoints should enable HTTPS to secure traffic to the backend custom origin.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS and disable HTTP for each custom origin endpoint for each CDN profile.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: TDE Protector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQL Server TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
tests.more_info: Enabling BYOK in the TDE protector allows for greater control and transparency, as well as increasing security by having full control of the encryption keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that a BYOK key is set for the Transparent Data Encryption of each SQL Server.

tests.title: Key Expiration Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Keys in Azure Key Vault have an expiry time set.
tests.more_info: Setting an expiry time on all keys forces key rotation and removes unused and forgotten keys from being used.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each Key Vault has an expiry time set that provides for sufficient rotation.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: Key Vault Log Analytics Enabled
tests.description: Ensures Key Vault Log Analytics logs are being properly delivered to Azure Monitor
tests.more_info: Enabling Send to Log Analytics ensures that all Key Vault logs are being properly monitored and managed.
tests.recommended_action: Send all diagnostic logs for Key Vault from the Azure Monitor service to Log Analytics.

tests.title: TLS Version Check
tests.description: Ensures that all web apps are using the latest version of TLS
tests.more_info: App Services currently allows web apps to use TLS versions 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2. It is highly recommended to use the latest TLS 1.2 version for web app TLS connections.
tests.recommended_action: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for all App Services.
tests.remediation_description: TLS version 1.2 will be set for the affected Web Apps

tests.title: LB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures load balancers are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports
tests.more_info: For maximum security, load balancers can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections will be blocked. This should only be done if the client application is configured to query HTTPS directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each load balancer only accepts connections on port 443.

tests.title: Enforce MySQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connection is enforced on MySQL servers
tests.more_info: MySQL servers should be set to use SSL for data transmission to ensure all data is encrypted in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security of each Azure Database for MySQL is configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected MySQL servers

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

data.name: Data from Cloud Storage Object
data.description: Data in cloud storage should have appropriate measures to maintain integrity and confidentiality.

tests.title: Storage Accounts Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for Storage Accounts
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all Storage Accounts are configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: VM OS Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that VM OS Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM OS disks (boot volume) ensures that the entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM OS Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: VM Data Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensure that Data Disk Encryption is enabled for virtual machines
tests.more_info: Encrypting VM Data Disks (non-boot volume) ensures that its entire contents are fully unrecoverable without a key, protecting the volume from unwarranted reads
tests.recommended_action: Enable VM Data Disk Encryption on all virtual machines

tests.title: Monitor Disk Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Disk Encryption monitoring is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits disk encryption in all virtual machines to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Disk Encryption from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for virtual machines.

tests.title: Monitor SQL Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Monitor SQL Encryption is enabled in Security Center
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center will monitor for unencrypted SQL databases, associated backups, and transaction log files.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure SQL encryption monitoring is configured for SQL databases from the Azure Security Center.

tests.title: Log Storage Encryption
tests.description: Ensures BYOK encryption is properly configured in the Activity Log Storage Account
tests.more_info: Storage accounts can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt the storage account, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the Storage Account used by Activity Logs is configured with a BYOK key.

tests.title: TDE Protector Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQL Server TDE protector is encrypted with BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
tests.more_info: Enabling BYOK in the TDE protector allows for greater control and transparency, as well as increasing security by having full control of the encryption keys.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that a BYOK key is set for the Transparent Data Encryption of each SQL Server.

tests.title: Monitor Blob Encryption
tests.description: Ensures that Blob Storage Encryption monitoring is enabled
tests.more_info: When this setting is enabled, Security Center audits blob encryption in all storage accounts to enhance data at rest protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Storage Accounts from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used for blob encryption.

tests.title: File Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures data encryption is enabled for File Services
tests.more_info: File Service encryption protects your data at rest. Azure Storage encrypts your data and automatically decrypts it for you as you access it.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that data encryption is enabled for each File Service.

tests.title: Blob Service Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is properly configured for Blob Services
tests.more_info: Blob Services can be configured to encrypt data-at-rest. By default Azure will create a set of keys to encrypt Blob Services, but the recommended approach is to create your own keys using Azure Key Vault.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that Blob Service is configured to use a customer-provided key vault key.

tests.title: Database Auditing Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that SQL Database Auditing is enabled
tests.more_info: Enabling SQL Database Auditing ensures that all database activities are being logged properly, including potential malicious activity.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that auditing is enabled for each SQL database.

tests.title: DB Restorable
tests.description: Ensures SQL Database instances can be restored to a recent point
tests.more_info: Automated backups of SQL databases with recent restore points help ensure that database recovery operations can occur without significant data loss.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each SQL database has automated backups configured with a sufficient retention period and that the last known backup operation completes successfully.

tests.title: Storage Accounts AAD Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure Files
tests.more_info: Enabling identity-based Authentication ensures that only the authorized Active Directory members can access or connect to the file shares, enforcing granular access control.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that identity-based Directory Service for Azure File Authentication is enabled for all Azure File Shares.

tests.title: Enforce MySQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connection is enforced on MySQL servers
tests.more_info: MySQL servers should be set to use SSL for data transmission to ensure all data is encrypted in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security of each Azure Database for MySQL is configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected MySQL servers

tests.title: Enforce PostgreSQL SSL Connection
tests.description: Ensures SSL connections are enforced on PostgreSQL Servers
tests.more_info: SSL prevents infiltration attacks by encrypting the data stream between the server and application.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the connection security settings of each PostgreSQL server are configured to enforce SSL connections.
tests.remediation_description: The SSL enforcement option will be enabled for the affected PostreSQL servers

tests.title: Azure Active Directory Admin Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Active Directory admin is enabled on all SQL servers.
tests.more_info: Enabling Active Directory admin allows users to manage account admins in a central location, allowing key rotation and permission management to be managed in one location for all servers and databases.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure Azure Active Directory admin is enabled on all SQL servers.

data.name: Defacement
data.description: Disaster recovery procedures prevents the consequences that might be incurred during a defacement.

tests.title: DB Restorable
tests.description: Ensures SQL Database instances can be restored to a recent point
tests.more_info: Automated backups of SQL databases with recent restore points help ensure that database recovery operations can occur without significant data loss.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each SQL database has automated backups configured with a sufficient retention period and that the last known backup operation completes successfully.

data.name: Endpoint Denial of Service
data.description: Attackers attempts to deny legitimate users access to endpoint services should be prevented.

tests.title: Detect Insecure Custom Origin
tests.description: Ensures that HTTPS is enabled for CDN endpoints with a custom origin
tests.more_info: All Azure CDN endpoints should enable HTTPS to secure traffic to the backend custom origin.
tests.recommended_action: Enable HTTPS and disable HTTP for each custom origin endpoint for each CDN profile.

tests.title: Endpoint Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that endpoint requests are being logged for CDN endpoints
tests.more_info: Endpoint Logging ensures that all requests to a CDN endpoint are logged.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that diagnostic logging is enabled for each CDN endpoint for each CDN profile

data.name: Network Denial of Service
data.description: Attackers attempts to deny legitimate users access to network services should be prevented.

tests.title: Application Whitelisting Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that Security Center Monitor Adaptive Application Whitelisting is enabled
tests.more_info: Adaptive application controls work in conjunction with machine learning to analyze processes running in a VM and help control which applications can run, hardening the VM against malware.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Adaptive Application Controls for Virtual Machines from the Azure Security Center by ensuring AuditIfNotExists setting is used.

tests.title: Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that Virtual Networks have multiple networks to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: A single network within a Virtual Network increases the risk of a broader blast radius in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Create multiple networks/subnets in each Virtual Network and change the architecture to take advantage of public and private tiers.
